alert.note: Alert for Bent (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 07 at 7:12PM MDT until June 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Bent County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 712 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near John Martin Reservoir, or 23 miles east of North La Junta, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... John Martin Reservoir, Hasty and Caddoa. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
